snippet: Former Gov. John G. Rowland, found guilty of political corruption charges in September, was sentenced to 30 months in prison and ordered to pay a $35,000 fine.
abstract: Federal Judge Janet Bond Arterton sentences former Connecticut Gov John G Rowland to 30 months in prison for corrupt political acts, same crime for which he served one-year sentence 10 years earlier; Rowland had been found guilty of seven counts that included obstructing justice, conspiracy and falsifying documents.

byline.original: By KRISTIN HUSSEY and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Kristin Hussey reported from New Haven, and Marc Santora from New York.

lead_paragraph: Former Gov. John G. Rowland, found guilty of political corruption charges in September, was sentenced to 30 months in prison and ordered to pay a $35,000 fine.

headline.main: Judge Sends Rowland, Ex-Connecticut Governor, Back to Prison
headline.print_headline: Judge Sends Ex-Connecticut Governor Back to Prison for 30 Months
